text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with asparagus tart that's right I
really wanted to call this asparagus
raft but unfortunately that's not a
thing so we're going to a tart and the
usual reason for making these is my love
of asparagus but this time it was my
love of using a puff pastry that I found
in the freezer so that's what happened
this time and this was the result so let
me show you how to put this together and
the first thing you're going to need to
do is find some frozen puff pastry in
your freezer of course buy some and
we're going to put that down on a Silpat
lined baking sheet and as you can see
here that's fully thawed very important
it's got to be thought all the way and
the reason we want this fully thawed is
because the first step here is we're
going to go around the edge and kind of
fold it over and roll it up to make the
outside crust so I'm going to go around
with my fingers kind of folding it
rolling it up like this and actually as
you can see here one finger does a
fantastic job and don't worry about
trying to make it perfect this is a
rustic tart okay and after we've gone
around and rolled up that edge we're
going to take a fork and we're going to
start pricking it and we're going to
prick it and we're going to continue
pricking it until it's fully and
completely pricked over however we don't
call it pricking that doesn't sound good
we call it docking and then once that's
been completely and utterly docked we're
going to go ahead and pop that in a 400
degree oven for 10 minutes and this is
just the pre baking it's going to get
baked again so we're going to pop that
in for 10 minutes and when it comes out
you're going to be thinking why did you
just make us do all that work alright
that's understandable because it doesn't
look like we did anything but fear not
check this out
we're going to take the back of a fork
and while this is still hot we're just
going to press it down with the back of
the fork like that and the part of the
dough that we docked will flatten out
and as you'll see the part we rolled up
around the edge will stay just like that
okay so hopefully everybody feels better
now and then all we're going to do is
just let that sit there and cool while
we prep our asparagus which is super
easy because all we're going to do is
give them a very quick boil and I mean
quick so what we'll do is we'll bring
some generously salted water to a boil
we're going to throw in our trimmed
asparagus spears and we're only going to
let these cook for 60 seconds this is
referred to as blanching and of course
that technique was named after its
inventor chef blanch you guys will
believe anything ton but anyway like I
said we're just going to give it 60
seconds and then we're going to fish it
out into some ice water and I say ice
water because that's what they told
using culinary school but I always just
use very cold water and it works every
time
so save your ice for the margaritas and
then as soon as those are cold go ahead
and drain that and reserve until needed
and then besides the pastry and the
asparagus we're going to need to do a
little bit of a creamy mustard sauce for
the bottom so in a ramekin we're going
to take a spoon of Dijon a little spoon
of creme fraiche or sour cream some
freshly ground black pepper and a pinch
of cayenne and then we'll mix that up
well and you'll notice I'm not putting
any salt in here our pastry has salt in
it and of course we blanched our
asparagus in very well salted water
so the seasoning should be fine plus
we're going to top this with a little
bit of parmesan so anyway we're going to
mix up that sauce and then once that's
thoroughly mixed up we'll take a couple
teaspoons and we'll spread it evenly
into the bottom of our now cooled tart
shell all right not too little not too
much I'm recommending you use the
perfect amount as seen here and then
once that's done we're going to go ahead
and take our now drained and dried
asparagus spears and lay them in and is
relaying these in here let me go ahead
and say something super obvious you're
going to need to trim these asparagus so
they fit perfectly inside your tart
shell I mean the original shape of your
puff pastry should be close but of
course you might have to do some
fine-tuning and trimming and of course
how many you get in here depends on the
size shooting four five but right about
here I was like hey you know what you
could sneak another one in there let's
do it which I did so for me six fit
perfectly and then once our asparagus
has been placed in let's go ahead and
take a little bit of melted butter and
brush that over the spears are you
brushing things with butter before they
go in the oven is usually never a bad
idea
sure if you got a couple extra drops go
ahead and brush a little bit on the
crust although that stuff's like 60%
butter anyway so it doesn't matter but
still and then last but not least before
this goes in the oven we're gonna give
that a very light dusting of parmesan
and have I mentioned lately you should
use the really expensive
parmigiano-reggiano okay so we're going
to give that a light but thorough
dusting and then that's going to go back
in our 400 degree oven for about ten to
12 minutes or until it looks like this
check it out that's pretty that's real
pretty
your crush should be perfectly golden
brown and the color on that asparagus is
going to deepen a little but it should
be still a very beautiful dark green now
this point I'm usually telling you to
let it cool down a little bit you really
don't have to in this case you can serve
this piping hot you can serve this warm
you can sir
this room temperature this believe it or
not is even good cold so very versatile
so at that point we're going to go ahead
and plate that up I serve mine with a
little charred pepper and arugula salad
that's charred red pepper and arugula
oil vinegar okay but anyway that's it
simple asparagus tart I mean for how
gorgeous that looks that was actually
pretty easy just a brilliant combination
of that crispy buttery pastry that sweet
still almost firm but perfectly tender
asparagus and then just that little
touch of creamy mustard sauce underneath
bringing the two main components
together it's just an excellent thing to
eat speaking of that sauce don't worry
if you think it's going to make
everything soggy it doesn't check this
out that bottom is still going to be
beautifully browned and crispy so
asparagus should be very abundant right
now and literally every grocery store in
the country that has a freezer case
